name: Young Girl, Big Dreams
description:
This project is sound-based, so be sure to have your volume on before playing!

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

“I was listening to these guys on the lounge argue about how long it would take me to flunk out.”

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Young Girl, Big Dreams is a game following the path of a young girl trying to major in the STEM field but feeling intimidated by its male-dominated classes. Each option mimics the experience of three unique women in STEM working at the University of California, Santa Cruz. It is a story about the struggles women face trying to break through the gender barrier, but it also touches upon the intersectionality of womanhood, ethnicity, and gender nonconformity. We want to encourage young girls to pursue their passions despite the struggles they may face due to inequalities in the field, paving the way for future generations of women who will follow in their footsteps.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

This was an assignment for UCSC's CRWN 86 Fall 2018 course. If the game won't load, try refreshing the page or running it on a different browser!

It's encouraged not to click on the next choice options before the speaker finishes talking to ensure the voice lines don't overlap.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Artist: Holly Cheng

Programmer: Sofia Santos

Cinematographer: Namratha Prithviraj

Women Featured in this Project:

  • Micha Cardenas - Art & Design: Games and Playable Media Professor
  • Tracy Larrabee - Computer Engineering Professor
  • Nandini Bhattacharya - Math Lecturer and Associate Director for Teaching for CITL
